poem:
### Fragment of Today

In Gaza's dust,  
where cries mingle  
with whispers of wind,  
numbers unfurl,  
cold, stark—a tally of loss.  
Beyond the ink,  
beyond borders—  
a child's shadow flickers  
in the smoldering light,  
a heart beats  
amid the rubble,  
counting breaths,  
counting stars,  
where humanity  
should count.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: Israeli-backed logistics group starts operations despite UN objections 11.51am BST Death toll from Israeli attacks on Gaza exceeds 54,000, says health ministry At least 54,056 Palestinian people have been killed and 123,129 injured in Israeli attacks on Gaza since 7 October 2023, the Gaza health ministry said in a statement on Tuesday. At least 79 Palestinian people were killed and 163 others injured in the last 24 hours alone, the ministry said". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel-Gaza war live: Israeli-backed logistics group starts operations despite UN objections 11.51am BST Death toll from Israeli attacks on Gaza exceeds 54,000, says health ministry At least 54,056 Palestinian people have been killed and 123,129 injured in Israeli attacks on Gaza since 7 October 2023, the Gaza health ministry said in a statement on Tuesday. At least 79 Palestinian people were killed and 163 others injured in the last 24 hours alone, the ministry said
